ProcessSpecification.name: PIP2C8BillOfMaterialNotification
ProcessSpecification.Documentation: This PIP is designed to easily and efficiently communicate BOM information about the parts that go into a product from engineering to manufacturing. It solves a variety of problems that impact the quality, availability, cost, performance and evolution of the product. Product quality is improved by reducing the occurrence of mismatched materials. Better communication of the materials required enables the manufacturer to have the parts available, improving the availability of the product. Support for regional buying, where equivalent materials need to be sourced in different regions worldwide, also enhances availability. Greater visibility of materials across multiple products allows for greater reuse and economies in purchasing. As the product evolves, changes to the BOM can be communicated efficiently.

BusinessDocument.name: Bill Of Material Notification
BusinessDocument.Documentation: Contains Bill Of Material data for a given product. The Bill Of Material specifies each component part, listing quantities, serial number requirements and potential alternate parts.

RequestingBusinessActivity.name: Initiate Process Bill Of Material Notification

BinaryCollaboration.name: Bill Of Material Notification
BinaryCollaboration.Documentation: The PIP Start State is comprised of the following conditions: a. TPA Approved and Exist In Backend System b. Sending Partner Exist as Party and Valid c. Receiving Partner Exist as Party d. Business Document Exist In Backend System, and Valid.

The PIP End States are comprised of the following conditions: a. Acknowledgment of Receipt Exist In Backend System, and Valid b. Receiving Partner Authorized ; PIP Failure State: a. NOT Successful b. Retry Count Exceeded
